activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 215, Branch 2

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber Renee Bartlett

ADDRESS INFO for Amber Renee Bartlett
Current: 340 5th Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 10-14-2022)
Prior: 1324 Elizabeth Ave, Marinette, WI 54143

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No possession of any dangerous weapons whatsoever.

Case called @ 1:28 PM: Defendant Amber Renee Bartlett appeared by Zoom, in custody. Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by Zoom for Amber Renee Bartlett. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Advised of right of Counsel. DE is eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. The Court further questions Atty Blankschein. Court orders: $1000 cash bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
